column1: '''The Ent's Marching Song''' is a song chanted by the [[Ents]] of [[Fangorn Forest]] as they marched on [[Isengard]]. It appears in the chapter "[[Treebeard (chapter)|Treebeard]]".
The chant began with a loud cry of "''ra-hoom-rah!''" and was accompanied by a sound like the rolling beats and booms of solemn drums.

column2: we come with roll of drum: ta-runda runda runda rom!
we come with horn and drum: ta-rūna rūna rūna rom!

column1: To Isengard! Though Isengard be ringed and barred with doors of stone;
Though Isengard be strong and hard
column2: as cold as stone and bare as bone

column4: to hew the stone and break the door;

column1: For bole and bough are burning now
column2: the furnace roars - we go to war!

column1: To land of gloom with tramp of doom
To Isengard with doom we come!
* [[Poems in The Lord of the Rings]]
